main event: An observation of a cloud-like object in the sky was reported on March 18, 1952, in Old Westbury, L.I., N.Y.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 5 to 10 seconds.,The object was traveling at high speed toward the east.,It was initially identified as a cloud or round ball.,The conclusion of the observation indicates it was likely a mistaken identification due to weather conditions.,Various weather conditions were noted during the time of the sighting.
sighted object: cloud or round ball in the sky
witness description: A lady was reported to be observing the object along with children, who did not notice it.
